title.narrative: EMERGENCY EDUCATION RESPONSE

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, more children have equitable access to early learning and complete primary education, acquiring basic literacy and numeracy competencies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: UNICEF supported MINEDH to restore education opportunity for 11,594 pre-primary school children (3-5 years old) and 115,566 primary children (6-18 years old) in the Cyclones-affected areas in the central and northern region through (I) provision of education in emergency (EiE) supplies, (ii) training of XXXX teachers and Early childhood education facilitators on the use of teaching materials and psychosocial support (PSS), as well as (iii) establishing 396 Temporary Learning Spaces (TLS). | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:09/01/2020
